intro: Cleistanthus papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
